paragraphs.text: Could Indiana Gov  Mike Pence be our next president?
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: INDIANAPOLIS
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: If
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: success at the state level were enough to recommend someone for president of the United States
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Gov  Mike Pence of Indiana would be among the frontrunners for the 2016 GOP presidential nomination
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: According to the governor's office, Pence has "signed into law $643 million in annual tax relief
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: That includes: $313 million for hardworking Hoosiers, thanks to last year's 5 percent income tax reduction, the largest state tax cut in Indiana history."
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: In addition
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the state corporate tax rate was reduced from 6.5 percent to 4.9 percent, making it the third lowest in the country and contributing to Indiana's increase in the labor force
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: which, Pence's office says, has grown by more than 51,000 over the past year, five times the national growth rate
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: It helps to have large majorities of one's party in the legislature
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Pence consults and has good relationships with Democrats
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: who frequently vote with the Republican majority because his programs work
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Sitting with the governor in his high-ceiling office beneath portraits of two Indiana governors who became presidents of the United States-- William Henry Harrison and Benjamin Harrison
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Pence tells me he is focused on the upcoming legislative session, which is expected to last four months, and won't think seriously about running for president until the session ends
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: Then
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: he says,"We'll probably take some time as a family to reflect and pray and make decisions about our future."
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: In his mind, Pence may have already crafted a winning scenario
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: He may be focused on his state
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: he thinks a lot about the country
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: which he served for 10 years as a congressman
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: A former Democrat (like his ideological mentor Ronald Reagan), Pence sees a need to transform his party's image
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: "The Republican Party has become just the other party to Washington solutions
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: We have to get back to advancing state- based solutions and reforms
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: We must be relentlessly optimistic."
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: He paraphrases a Reagan line:"' Why shouldn't we dream great dreams, after all we're Americans
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: There was a confidence and optimism I think our party would do well to repair to
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: There' s a lot wrong with our national government
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: we've got to stop confusing our national government with our nation."
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: That's a good line for a stump speech
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Pence wants to move from opposing bad ideas in Washington, to focusing on the success records in many states
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: For example
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Pence's education agenda includes a goal of taking children in underperforming schools and putting them in good schools
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: "By the year 2020, I want 100,000 more Indiana students in high- quality schools than we have today
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: Today, we have 105,000 kids who are in underperforming or failing schools."
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: He wants to fix traditional schools, pay good teachers more, giving bonuses to the best, and expand vocational education to every high school in the state
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: "We have the largest education voucher program in America
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: I want to expand that by lifting the cap and encouraging more private investment."
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: Indiana also has 75 charter schools
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Pence declines an invitation to comment on former Gov  Jeb Bush's recent remarks about having to lose the primary in order to win the general election
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: which many conservatives view as an attack on the party's base
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: If
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Hillary Clinton becomes the Democratic Party's presidential nominee
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I asked, is she beatable?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Pence answers indirectly, saying he thinks 2016 will be the first foreign policy election since 1980
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: that as a former secretary of state, Clinton will have some advantages
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: That's why he thinks the eventual GOP nominee should do as George W  Bush did in 2000
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: name a group of advisers with strong foreign policy credentials
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: to advise him during a campaign
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: if
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: he is successful
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: some might serve in his administration
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Mike Pence is a model of humility and restraint
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: While
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: some characterize Obama as a failed president
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Pence will only label his tenure "disappointing."
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: That in itself is in sharp contrast to the hubris, narcissism and self-awareness of Obama
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Humility, coupled with a proven track record of success and more confidence in the states and the people, is what's needed at the national level
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Mike Pence could be the one to bring it
paragraphs.label: assumption
